newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares ease with Autoliv, U.S. in focus.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares ease with Autoliv, U.S. in focus.

text.p: Swedish shares opened lower on Monday although telecoms group Ericsson inched ahead.
Brokers said in the dearth of news they would be looking at the opening of Wall Street for direction.
At 0825 GMT the general index had edged down 0.13 percent to 3,175.05.
Eyes were also on the half-year report for car safety equipment maker Autoliv. Its result, expected to show a profit of $169 million before tax, is due around 1330 GMT.
Ericsson rose one crown to 365, Autoliv up 4.5 to 297.5.
